comments:
It happens because calling CDescriptor.saveProjectData() in
IndexerOptionDialogPage, it doesn't trap an exception (in case if this method
raises it).

Alex -

Can you give some steps to reproduce this? How did .cdtproject become read only?
Did you upgrade your project from a previous version?

I create project, then change status of .project & .cdtproject to read only,
open project properties dialog and switch to Indexer page. If you see the .log,
you can find there call stack. In dialog you can make any changes and they live
during the current session, but of course they are not saved.

Since CDT 3.0M6:

The Indexer Dialog now relies on the CDescriptor utilities to save info - and it
seems to be able to catch the exception properly. Making the .cdtproject and
.project files read-only and then trying to perform an operation which causes
save results in an entry in the .log file - but no exception.

- BG
